document: Prince Rogers Nelson, better known as Prince, was a tremendously talented American artist who left an indelible mark on the music industry. With his flamboyant and androgynous persona, he captured the attention of audiences worldwide. Not only was he an incredible singer with a wide vocal range, including a distinctive falsetto and powerful screams, but he was also a skilled multi-instrumentalist. Prince often played all or most of the instruments on his own recordings, showcasing his versatility and musical genius. His music transcended genre boundaries, incorporating elements of funk, R&B, rock, new wave, soul, synth-pop, pop, jazz, blues, and hip hop. Moreover, Prince was a pioneer, producing his albums himself and famously giving birth to the Minneapolis sound. His contributions to the music world, coupled with his numerous awards and accolades, make him undeniably one of the greatest musicians of his generation.
noref_document: Prince, the legendary musician, was one of the greatest musical icons of the 20th century. With a distinct style that blended funk, rock, pop, and R&B, Prince captivated audiences with his mesmerizing performances and groundbreaking music. Known for his flamboyant personality and gender-bending fashion choices, he pushed the boundaries of artistry and sexuality in the music industry. With hit songs like "Purple Rain," "Kiss," and "When Doves Cry," Prince established himself as an unparalleled artist and his music continues to influence generations of musicians to this day. Despite his untimely death in 2016, Prince's legacy lives on, reminding us of his extraordinary talent and the impact he made on the world of music.
summary: Prince Rogers Nelson (June 7, 1958 – April 21, 2016) was an American singer, songwriter, musician, record producer, and actor. The recipient of numerous awards and nominations, he is widely regarded as one of the greatest musicians of his generation. He was known for his flamboyant, androgynous persona; his wide vocal range, which included a far-reaching falsetto and high-pitched screams; and his skill as a multi-instrumentalist, often preferring to play all or most of the instruments on his recordings.  His music incorporated a wide variety of styles, including funk,  R&B,  rock,  new wave,  soul,  synth-pop,  pop,  jazz, blues, and hip hop. Prince produced his albums himself, pioneering the Minneapolis sound.

document: Carrie Fisher, a renowned American actress and writer, left an indelible mark on the entertainment industry. Though she had a versatile career, Fisher is best remembered for her iconic portrayal of Princess Leia in the original Star Wars films. Her fiery personality and fearless demeanor resonated with audiences worldwide, making her a beloved figure in the Star Wars universe. Despite her tragic passing in 2016, Fisher's legacy endured as she posthumously appeared in subsequent Star Wars films. Beyond her Star Wars success, Fisher showcased her talent in various other movies like Shampoo, The Blues Brothers, When Harry Met Sally..., and The Women. Her remarkable performances earned her nominations for the Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Guest Actress. Carrie Fisher will always be remembered as a trailblazer and an inspiration to many in the entertainment industry.
noref_document: Carrie Fisher, the iconic actress, author, and advocate, is best known for her groundbreaking role as Princess Leia in the original Star Wars trilogy. Her portrayal of Leia Organa captivated audiences with her strength, intelligence, and determination, making her an empowering figure for many young women. Beyond her acting career, Fisher was also a talented writer, penning several bestselling novels and memoirs that showcased her wit and vulnerability. Additionally, she openly discussed her struggles with mental health and addiction, becoming a prominent advocate for reducing the stigma surrounding these issues. Fisher's impact and legacy extend far beyond the galaxy far, far away, as she continues to inspire and empower countless individuals with her honesty, humor, and resilience.
summary: Carrie Frances Fisher (October 21, 1956 – December 27, 2016) was an American actress and writer. She was best known for playing Princess Leia in the original Star Wars films (1977–1983). She reprised the role in Star Wars: The Force Awakens (2015), The Last Jedi (2017) — a posthumous release that was dedicated to her — and appeared in The Rise of Skywalker (2019), through the use of unreleased footage from The Force Awakens.Fisher's other film credits include Shampoo (1975), The Blues Brothers (1980), Hannah and Her Sisters (1986), The 'Burbs (1989), When Harry Met Sally... (1989), Soapdish (1991), and The Women (2008). She was nominated twice for the Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Guest Actress in a Comedy Series for her performances in the NBC sitcom 30 Rock (2007) and the Channel 4 series Catastrophe (2017).

summary: Carrie Frances Fisher (October 21, 1956 – December 27, 2016) was an American actress and writer. She was best known for playing Princess Leia in the original Star Wars films (1977–1983). She reprised the role in Star Wars: The Force Awakens (2015), The Last Jedi (2017) — a posthumous release that was dedicated to her — and appeared in The Rise of Skywalker (2019), through the use of unreleased footage from The Force Awakens.Fisher's other film credits include Shampoo (1975), The Blues Brothers (1980), Hannah and Her Sisters (1986), The 'Burbs (1989), When Harry Met Sally... (1989), Soapdish (1991), and The Women (2008). She was nominated twice for the Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Guest Actress in a Comedy Series for her performances in the NBC sitcom 30 Rock (2007) and the Channel 4 series Catastrophe (2017).

document: Chester Charles Bennington, the talented American singer, made a significant impact as the lead vocalist of rock band Linkin Park. His powerful vocals and emotional lyrics captivated audiences worldwide, especially following the release of the band's debut album, Hybrid Theory, in 2000. This album achieved remarkable success, earning a Diamond certification and becoming one of the bestselling debut albums of the decade. Bennington's undeniable talent and contribution to Linkin Park continued throughout their discography, with each subsequent studio album charting in the top three spots of the Billboard 200. In addition to his work with Linkin Park, Bennington formed the band Dead by Sunrise in 2005, showcasing his versatility and passion for music.
noref_document: Chester Bennington, the legendary American singer, songwriter, and musician, was widely recognized as the lead vocalist for the rock band Linkin Park. Bennington's powerful and emotive voice served as the driving force behind the band's chart-topping hits and their unique blend of alternative rock, nu-metal, and electronic music. Known for his raw and intense lyrics, he brought a sense of vulnerability and authenticity to his performances, captivating audiences around the world. With his distinctive vocal range and ability to express deep emotional pain, Bennington became an icon for a generation of music lovers, leaving an indelible mark on the music industry before his untimely passing in 2017.
summary:
Chester Charles Bennington (March 20, 1976 – July 20, 2017) was an American singer who served as the lead vocalist of rock band Linkin Park. He was also a lead vocalist of Grey Daze, Dead by Sunrise and Stone Temple Pilots at various points.
Bennington first gained prominence as a vocalist following the release of Linkin Park's debut album, Hybrid Theory (2000), which was a worldwide commercial success. The album was certified Diamond by the Recording Industry Association of America in 2005, making it the bestselling debut album of the decade, as well as one of the few albums ever to achieve that many sales. He continued to serve as the band's lead vocalist for their next six studio albums, from Meteora (2003) to One More Light (2017), with each charting within the top three spots of the Billboard 200.Bennington formed his own band, Dead by Sunrise, as a side project in 2005.

document: Chris Cornell was an American singer, songwriter, and musician who made a significant impact on the rock music scene. As the lead vocalist, rhythm guitarist, and primary lyricist for the renowned rock bands Soundgarden and Audioslave, Cornell showcased his immense talent, captivating audiences with his powerful vocal belting technique and his nearly four-octave vocal range. Apart from his work with these bands, Cornell had a successful solo career and contributed to various movie soundtracks. He founded Temple of the Dog as a tribute band to his late friend Andrew Wood, further showcasing his musical versatility and his ability to connect with fans on a deeper level. Cornell's contributions to the grunge movement of the 1990s solidified his status as one of the greatest rock singers of all time.
noref_document: Chris Cornell was an iconic American singer, songwriter, and musician. He was best known as the lead vocalist for the bands Soundgarden and Audioslave, and his powerful voice and unique songwriting style made him one of the most influential figures in the grunge and alternative rock movements of the 1990s. With a four-octave vocal range, Cornell captivated audiences with his soulful and often introspective lyrics. Throughout his career, he released several successful solo albums and collaborated with numerous artists, further cementing his reputation as a versatile and talented musician. Unfortunately, Cornell tragically passed away in 2017, but his impact on the music world continues to be celebrated and cherished.
summary: Christopher John Cornell (né Boyle; July 20, 1964 – May 18, 2017) was an American singer, songwriter and musician best known as the lead vocalist, rhythm guitarist, and primary lyricist for the rock bands Soundgarden and Audioslave. He also had a solo career and contributed to numerous movie soundtracks. Cornell was the founder and frontman of Temple of the Dog, a one-off tribute band dedicated to his late friend Andrew Wood. Several music journalists, fan polls and fellow musicians have regarded Cornell as one of the greatest rock singers of all time.Cornell is considered one of the key figures of the 1990s grunge movement. He is well known for his extensive catalog as a songwriter, his nearly four-octave vocal range, and his powerful vocal belting technique.

He founded Temple of the Dog as a tribute band to his late friend Andrew Wood, further showcasing his musical versatility and his ability to connect with fans on a deeper level. Cornell's contributions to the grunge movement of the 1990s solidified his status as one of the greatest rock singers of all time.

With a four-octave vocal range, Cornell captivated audiences with his soulful and often introspective lyrics. Throughout his career, he released several successful solo albums and collaborated with numerous artists, further cementing his reputation as a versatile and talented musician. Unfortunately, Cornell tragically passed away in 2017, but his impact on the music world continues to be celebrated and cherished.

document: Avicii, the professional name of Tim Bergling, was more than just a DJ, remixer, and music producer—he was a trailblazer in the electronic music scene. The Swedish artist first gained attention at a young age by sharing his remixes on electronic music forums. The recognition led to a record deal, launching his career to new heights. Avicii's breakthrough single "Levels" propelled him to stardom in 2011, and he continued to push boundaries with his debut studio album, True. With its blend of electronic music and diverse genres, the album garnered positive reviews and achieved commercial success worldwide. One of its standout tracks, "Wake Me Up," secured the number one spot in numerous European music markets and reached number four in the United States. Avicii's contributions to the music industry will be remembered and celebrated for years to come.
noref_document: Avicii was a Swedish musician, DJ, and record producer known for his innovative and influential contributions to electronic dance music. His unique sound blended catchy melodies, infectious beats, and emotive lyrics, creating a distinct fusion of pop and EDM. With chart-topping hits like "Wake Me Up" and "Levels," Avicii brought EDM into the mainstream, captivating audiences worldwide. However, beyond his commercial success, Avicii also struggled with mental health issues and the pressures of fame. His untimely death in 2018 served as a tragic reminder of the toll that the music industry can take on artists. Nonetheless, Avicii's impact on the world of electronic music remains profound, and his legacy continues to inspire aspiring musicians and fans alike to push boundaries and express themselves through the power of music.
summary: Tim Bergling (Swedish: [ˈtɪmː ˈbæ̂rjlɪŋ] ; 8 September 1989 – 20 April 2018), known professionally as Avicii ( ə-VEE-chee, Swedish: [aˈvɪ̌tːɕɪ]), was a Swedish DJ, remixer, and music producer. At age 16, Bergling began posting his remixes on electronic music forums, which led to his first record deal. He rose to prominence in 2011 with his single "Levels". His debut studio album, True (2013), blended electronic music with elements of multiple genres and received generally positive reviews. It peaked in the top 10 in more than 15 countries and topped international charts; the lead single, "Wake Me Up", topped most music markets in Europe and reached number four in the United States.

document: Vine, a popular American short-form video hosting service, allowed users to share six-second-long looping video clips. Launched in 2013 by Vine Labs, Inc., it was acquired by Twitter, Inc. even before its official release. Sadly, Vine was shut down in 2017, with the discontinuation of its app a few months later. The service provided the option to share videos on various social networking platforms like Facebook and Twitter. Users could also explore themed groups of videos, hoping to see their own creations "trend."
noref_document: Vine was a short-form video hosting service that allowed users to share and watch six-second looping video clips. It quickly gained popularity as a platform for creative expression, with users showcasing their talents, humor, and storytelling abilities in compact and captivating videos. Vine provided a space for aspiring content creators to build a following and collaborate with others, and it paved the way for the rise of internet personalities and influencers. The app was known for its vibrant and diverse community, where users could discover and engage with a wide range of content, from comedy skits and music performances to DIY tutorials and mesmerizing visual effects. Although Vine was discontinued in 2017, its impact on internet culture and the way we consume and create content continues to resonate.
summary: Vine was an American short-form video hosting service where users could share six-second-long looping video clips. It was originally launched on January 24, 2013, by Vine Labs, Inc. Bought by Twitter, Inc. in 2012 before its launch, the service was shut down on January 17, 2017, and the app was discontinued a few months later.Videos published on Vine's social network could also be shared on different social networking platforms such as Facebook and Twitter. The Vine app was also used to browse videos, along with a group of videos that were uploaded by theme, and hoping that users could "trend" videos.

document: Rdio, a once popular online music streaming service, provided users with the ability to stream music for free with ads, or subscribe for an ad-free experience. With availability in 85 countries, it offered various platforms such as Android, iOS, Windows Phone, and even systems like Roku and Sonos. Users could stream music directly from Rdio's servers or download content for offline playback. Additionally, Rdio had a desktop client application for both OS X and Windows, along with a Windows Store application. Its impressive library included content from major record labels, as well as the Merlin Network and several aggregators. Moreover, Rdio incorporated social networking features, allowing users to share their favorite songs, albums, and playlists on Rdio and other platforms like Facebook and Twitter. Although Rdio faced financial troubles and filed for bankruptcy in 2015, it managed to sell certain intellectual property to Pandora Radio.
noref_document: Rdio is a music streaming service that was founded in 2008 and gained popularity for its vast library of songs and user-friendly interface. It allowed users to discover and listen to a wide range of music from various genres, making it a beloved platform for music enthusiasts. Rdio also incorporated social features, allowing users to follow their friends and listen to their playlists, fostering a sense of community within the platform. Despite its early success, Rdio eventually faced financial challenges and filed for bankruptcy in 2015. However, its legacy lives on, as it paved the way for the development of other popular music streaming services like Spotify and Apple Music.
summary:
Rdio (pronounced  "r-dee-oh") was an online music streaming service that offered ad-supported free streaming and ad-free subscription streaming services in 85 countries. It was available as a website and via app for Android, BlackBerry, iOS, and Windows Phone mobile devices, which could stream music from Rdio's servers or download music for offline playback; there were also clients for the Roku and Sonos systems. The web-based service also offered a native desktop client application for OS X and Windows, as well as a Windows Store application.Rdio's library had content from the four major record labels, as well as the Merlin Network and the aggregators BFM Digital, Catapult, CD Baby, boomertunes, INgrooves, and The Orchard. Rdio also offered social networking features, such as the ability to share songs, albums, and playlists with others on Rdio and social networks such as Facebook and Twitter.
On November 16, 2015, Rdio filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy in which they had to pay $200 million and announced the sale of certain intellectual property to Pandora Radio.

document: Aereo, a technology company based in New York City, revolutionized the way people accessed and consumed television content. Through their innovative platform, subscribers were able to watch live and time-shifted streams of over-the-air television on their Internet-connected devices. Launched in March 2012 with the backing of Barry Diller's IAC, Aereo quickly gained popularity among users seeking a more flexible and personalized viewing experience. However, their journey was met with a significant setback when on June 25, 2014, the Supreme Court ruled against them in a case presented by several broadcast networks. The court deemed that Aereo's business model violated copyright holders' rights, as it was viewed as a "public performance" without obtaining necessary permissions. This ruling, despite the technological distinctions, equated Aereo's services to those of traditional cable television providers, ultimately leading to their downfall.
noref_document: Aereo is a now-defunct American technology company that provided a subscription-based service for streaming live and time-shifted over-the-air television programs online. Founded in 2012, Aereo aimed to enable consumers to access broadcast television stations using individually assigned antennas housed in remote data centers. This innovative approach allowed users to watch and record live television on various internet-connected devices without requiring a cable or satellite TV subscription. However, due to legal challenges from broadcast networks, Aereo was eventually forced to suspend its operations in 2014, marking the end of its short-lived but groundbreaking venture.
summary: Aereo was a technology company based in New York City that allowed subscribers to view live and time-shifted streams of over-the-air television on Internet-connected devices. The service opened to customers in March 2012, and was backed by Barry Diller's IAC.On June 25, 2014, the Supreme Court ruled against Aereo in a case brought by several broadcast networks. The Court found that Aereo infringed upon the rights of copyright holders. The point of contention was whether Aereo's business model constituted a "public performance", which would legally require it to obtain permission from the copyright owners of any programs it transmits. The court ruled in a 6–3 decision that Aereo's business model was no different from that of a cable television provider, despite the differences in technology.

However, due to legal challenges from broadcast networks, Aereo was eventually forced to suspend its operations in 2014, marking the end of its short-lived but groundbreaking venture.
summary: Aereo was a technology company based in New York City that allowed subscribers to view live and time-shifted streams of over-the-air television on Internet-connected devices. The service opened to customers in March 2012, and was backed by Barry Diller's IAC.On June 25, 2014, the Supreme Court ruled against Aereo in a case brought by several broadcast networks. The Court found that Aereo infringed upon the rights of copyright holders. The point of contention was whether Aereo's business model constituted a "public performance", which would legally require it to obtain permission from the copyright owners of any programs it transmits. The court ruled in a 6–3 decision that Aereo's business model was no different from that of a cable television provider, despite the differences in technology.

document: Grooveshark, an innovative web-based music streaming service, allowed users to upload and stream digital audio files while organizing them in personalized playlists. With a comprehensive search engine, music streaming capabilities, and a sophisticated music recommendation system, Grooveshark provided a unique platform for music enthusiasts. Despite facing legal battles, including a major lawsuit from Universal Music Group, the company successfully defended its right to use pre-1972 recordings. However, Grooveshark was also sued by EMI Music Publishing, Sony Music Entertainment, and Warner Music Group for copyright violations. Consequently, Apple and Facebook removed Grooveshark's applications from their respective platforms due to concerns regarding copyright issues.
noref_document: Grooveshark is a now-defunct online music streaming platform that was launched in 2007. It allowed users to search and share music files, creating personalized playlists and discovering new songs based on their tastes. Grooveshark amassed a vast library of music from various genres and artists, providing a convenient and accessible way for users to listen to their favorite tracks. However, due to legal challenges and copyright infringement issues, Grooveshark was forced to shut down in 2015. Despite its controversial history, Grooveshark remains an important part of the evolution of online music streaming platforms.
summary: Grooveshark was a web-based music streaming service owned and operated by Escape Media Group in the United States. Users could upload digital audio files, which could then be streamed and organized in playlists. The Grooveshark website had a search engine, music streaming features, and a music recommendation system.The company won a major lawsuit filed by Universal Music Group concerning use of Universal's pre-1972 recordings. Grooveshark was also sued for copyright violations by EMI Music Publishing, Sony Music Entertainment, and Warner Music Group. Concerns about copyrights led Apple and Facebook to remove Grooveshark's applications from the iOS App Store and Facebook platform respectively.

document: The Ouya, a microconsole developed by Ouya Inc, made its debut in 2012 under the leadership of Julie Uhrman. Uhrman enlisted the help of designer Yves Béhar and VP of Product Management Muffi Ghadiali to bring the project to life. Through a successful Kickstarter campaign, the development of Ouya was funded with a remarkable $8.5 million, making it one of the most successful projects in the crowdfunding platform's history. In 2013, the console began shipping to Kickstarter backers in March and was released to the public in June. Featuring an application store tailored specifically for Ouya-compatible games and apps, the platform primarily offered a wide range of casual games to its users.
noref_document: Ouya is a microconsole released in 2013 that aimed to revolutionize the gaming industry. Developed by the company of the same name, Ouya gained attention for its open-source approach and affordability. It believed in democratizing game development by providing an accessible platform for independent developers to create and share their games. With a focus on indie games and an online marketplace, Ouya provided a unique gaming experience for users seeking fresh and innovative titles. However, Ouya struggled to compete with more established gaming consoles and faced challenges in attracting a wide audience. Despite its eventual discontinuation in 2015, Ouya's impact on the gaming industry cannot be denied, as it inspired a new wave of microconsoles and highlighted the importance of indie game development.
summary:
The Ouya ( OO-yə), stylized as OUYA, is an Android-based microconsole developed by Ouya Inc. Julie Uhrman founded the project in 2012, bringing in designer Yves Béhar to collaborate on its design and Muffi Ghadiali as VP of Product Management to put together the engineering team. Development was funded via Kickstarter, raising US$8.5 million, becoming one of the website's highest earning projects in its history.
Units started to ship to Kickstarter backers in March 2013 and were released to the general public in June 2013. It featured a store for applications and games designed specifically for the Ouya platform, the majority of which were casual games.

The Ouya ( OO-yə), stylized as OUYA, is an Android-based microconsole developed by Ouya Inc. document: The Burj Khalifa, formerly known as the Burj Dubai, stands tall and proud in the vibrant city of Dubai, United Arab Emirates. Rising to a staggering height of 829.8 meters (2,722 feet), it commands attention as the world's tallest building. The Burj Khalifa's impressive architecture includes a 242.6-meter spire, bringing its roof height to 828 meters (2,717 feet), surpassing the previous record-holder, Taipei 101. The construction of this monumental structure began in 2004 and was completed in 2009, showcasing a seamless blend of reinforced concrete and structural steel sourced from the Palace of the Republic in East Berlin. Located in the captivating neighborhood of Downtown Dubai, the Burj Khalifa has become a symbol of modernity and innovation.
noref_document: The Burj Khalifa is a towering skyscraper located in Dubai, United Arab Emirates. As the tallest building in the world, it stands at an impressive height of 828 meters (2,717 feet) with 163 floors. The construction of this architectural marvel began in 2004 and was completed in 2010, symbolizing the rapid growth and innovation of Dubai. Apart from its breathtaking height, the Burj Khalifa features a unique design inspired by Islamic architecture, with setbacks that create a spiraling effect, giving it an iconic appearance. Besides being a prominent landmark, the Burj Khalifa serves multiple purposes, including offering luxurious residential spaces, housing corporate offices, and hosting a wide variety of amenities. With its observation deck on the 148th floor, it provides visitors with unmatched panoramic views of the city and surrounding areas. The Burj Khalifa stands as a testament to human ingenuity and engineering prowess, capturing the imagination of millions worldwide.
summary: The Burj Khalifa (known as the Burj Dubai prior to its inauguration in 2010) is a skyscraper in Dubai, United Arab Emirates. It is the world's tallest building. With a total height of 829.8 m (2,722 ft, or just over half a mile) and a roof height (excluding antenna, but including a 242.6 m spire) of 828 m (2,717 ft), the Burj Khalifa has been the tallest structure and building in the world since its topping out in 2009, supplanting Taipei 101, the previous holder of that status.Construction of the Burj Khalifa began in 2004, with the exterior completed five years later in 2009. The primary structure is reinforced concrete and some of the structural steel for the building originated from the Palace of the Republic in East Berlin, the former East German parliament. The building was opened in 2010 as part of a new development called Downtown Dubai.

document: The Burj Khalifa, formerly known as the Burj Dubai, stands tall and proud in the vibrant city of Dubai, United Arab Emirates. Rising to a staggering height of 829.8 meters (2,722 feet), it commands attention as the world's tallest building. The Burj Khalifa's impressive architecture includes a 242.6-meter spire, bringing its roof height to 828 meters (2,717 feet), surpassing the previous record-holder, Taipei 101. The construction of this monumental structure began in 2004 and was completed in 2009, showcasing a seamless blend of reinforced concrete and structural steel sourced from the Palace of the Republic in East Berlin. Located in the captivating neighborhood of Downtown Dubai, the Burj Khalifa has become a symbol of modernity and innovation.
noref_document: The Burj Khalifa is a towering skyscraper located in Dubai, United Arab Emirates. Besides being a prominent landmark, the Burj Khalifa serves multiple purposes, including offering luxurious residential spaces, housing corporate offices, and hosting a wide variety of amenities. With its observation deck on the 148th floor, it provides visitors with unmatched panoramic views of the city and surrounding areas. The Burj Khalifa stands as a testament to human ingenuity and engineering prowess, capturing the imagination of millions worldwide.

document: The Shard, also known as the Shard London Bridge, is a remarkable 72-storey skyscraper located in Southwark, London. Designed by the renowned Italian architect Renzo Piano, it is the tallest building in the United Kingdom and Western Europe, standing at an impressive height of 309.6 metres (1,016 feet). The Shard forms part of The Shard Quarter development and replaced the previous 24-storey office block known as Southwark Towers. Construction on this iconic structure commenced in March 2009, and it was officially inaugurated on 5 July 2012, following its topping out on 30 March 2012.
noref_document: The Shard is a renowned skyscraper located in London, England. Standing at a height of 1,016 feet, it is currently the tallest building in the United Kingdom. Designed by the Italian architect Renzo Piano, The Shard has become an iconic symbol of modern architecture in London's skyline. With its distinctive glass facade, the building offers panoramic views of the city, attracting both locals and tourists alike. The Shard houses a range of facilities including offices, restaurants, a hotel, and even a public viewing gallery on its 72nd floor, providing visitors with breathtaking vistas of the capital.
summary:
The Shard, also referred to as the Shard London Bridge and formerly London Bridge Tower, is a 72-storey skyscraper, designed by the Italian architect Renzo Piano, in Southwark, London, that forms part of The Shard Quarter development. Standing 309.6 metres (1,016 feet) high, The Shard is the tallest building in the United Kingdom, and the tallest building in Western Europe. It is also the second-tallest free-standing structure in the United Kingdom, after the concrete tower of the Emley Moor transmitting station. It replaced Southwark Towers, a 24-storey office block built on the site in 1975.
The Shard's construction began in March 2009; it was topped out on 30 March 2012 and inaugurated on 5 July 2012.

Designed by the Italian architect Renzo Piano, The Shard has become an iconic symbol of modern architecture in London's skyline. With its distinctive glass facade, the building offers panoramic views of the city, attracting both locals and tourists alike. The Shard houses a range of facilities including offices, restaurants, a hotel, and even a public viewing gallery on its 72nd floor, providing visitors with breathtaking vistas of the capital.
summary:
The Shard, also referred to as the Shard London Bridge and formerly London Bridge Tower, is a 72-storey skyscraper, designed by the Italian architect Renzo Piano, in Southwark, London, that forms part of The Shard Quarter development. Standing 309.6 metres (1,016 feet) high, The Shard is the tallest building in the United Kingdom, and the tallest building in Western Europe. It is also the second-tallest free-standing structure in the United Kingdom, after the concrete tower of the Emley Moor transmitting station. It replaced Southwark Towers, a 24-storey office block built on the site in 1975.
The Shard's construction began in March 2009; it was topped out on 30 March 2012 and inaugurated on 5 July 2012.

document: Metropol Parasol, also known as Setas de Sevilla or The Mushrooms, is an impressive wooden structure located in the old quarter of Seville, Spain. Designed by German architect Jürgen Mayer, it was completed in April 2011 and is approximately 150 by 70 meters in size with a height of 26 meters. The structure features six parasols that resemble large mushrooms and is constructed using 3,500 cubic meters of micro-laminated Finnish pine. It houses a traditional market, restaurants, an archaeological museum, a performance square, and a rooftop terrace offering panoramic views of Seville's old city. Despite initial technical and budgetary challenges, Metropol Parasol has become the city's third most-visited urban landmark since its opening.
noref_document: Metropol Parasol, also known as Las Setas (The Mushrooms), is an iconic structure located in the heart of Seville, Spain. Designed by architect Jürgen Mayer, this unique wooden structure stands as the largest wooden structure in the world. Spanning over four levels, Metropol Parasol boasts a stunning architectural design that transforms the traditional perception of a plaza. The structure's undulating shape offers shade from the scorching Spanish sun, while its uppermost level provides breathtaking panoramic views of Seville's cityscape. Additionally, the lower levels of the structure host a vibrant market, housing numerous bars, cafes, and shops, creating a bustling atmosphere for locals and tourists alike. Metropol Parasol's emergence has brought a modern twist to the historic city of Seville, becoming a symbol of contemporary architecture and a must-visit landmark for visitors.
summary:
Setas de Sevilla ("Mushrooms of Seville") or Las Setas ("The Mushrooms"), initially titled Metropol Parasol, is a large, predominantly wood structure located at La Encarnación square in the old quarter of Seville, Spain. It accommodates a traditional market, restaurants, a performance square, archaeological museum — and 'rooftop' terrace with a panoramic view of Seville's old city.
Selected from 65 submissions in a city-sponsored competition, the structure was designed by German architect Jürgen Mayer, was completed in April 2011, and is roughly 150 by 70 metres (490 by 230 ft) with an approximate height of 26 metres (85 ft).Initially beset with technical problems as well as budget and schedule overruns, the parasols are constructed of 3,500 cubic meters of micro-laminated Finnish pine and are marketed as the world's largest wood structure.Since their opening, the parasols have become Seville's third-most visited urban landmark.


== The name ==
During development, the project was titled Metropol Parasol, with locals quickly adopting a colloquial nickname, the setas or mushrooms. Seville officially adopted the name Setas de Sevilla after discovering the project's architect had trademarked the name "Metropol Parasol" and would charge for its use; Setas de Sevilla has been the project's official name since opening,


== Design ==
The structure consists of six parasols loosely resembling large mushrooms, inspired by the vaults of the Cathedral of Seville and the ficus trees in the nearby Plaza de Cristo de Burgos.

document: Metropol Parasol, also known as Setas de Sevilla or The Mushrooms, is an impressive wooden structure located in the old quarter of Seville, Spain. Designed by German architect Jürgen Mayer, it was completed in April 2011 and is approximately 150 by 70 meters in size with a height of 26 meters. The structure features six parasols that resemble large mushrooms and is constructed using 3,500 cubic meters of micro-laminated Finnish pine. It houses a traditional market, restaurants, an archaeological museum, a performance square, and a rooftop terrace offering panoramic views of Seville's old city. Despite initial technical and budgetary challenges, Metropol Parasol has become the city's third most-visited urban landmark since its opening.
noref_document: Metropol Parasol, also known as Las Setas (The Mushrooms), is an iconic structure located in the heart of Seville, Spain. Designed by architect Jürgen Mayer, this unique wooden structure stands as the largest wooden structure in the world. Spanning over four levels, Metropol Parasol boasts a stunning architectural design that transforms the traditional perception of a plaza. The structure's undulating shape offers shade from the scorching Spanish sun, while its uppermost level provides breathtaking panoramic views of Seville's cityscape. Additionally, the lower levels of the structure host a vibrant market, housing numerous bars, cafes, and shops, creating a bustling atmosphere for locals and tourists alike. Metropol Parasol's emergence has brought a modern twist to the historic city of Seville, becoming a symbol of contemporary architecture and a must-visit landmark for visitors.
summary:
Setas de Sevilla ("Mushrooms of Seville") or Las Setas ("The Mushrooms"), initially titled Metropol Parasol, is a large, predominantly wood structure located at La Encarnación square in the old quarter of Seville, Spain. It accommodates a traditional market, restaurants, a performance square, archaeological museum — and 'rooftop' terrace with a panoramic view of Seville's old city.
Selected from 65 submissions in a city-sponsored competition, the structure was designed by German architect Jürgen Mayer, was completed in April 2011, and is roughly 150 by 70 metres (490 by 230 ft) with an approximate height of 26 metres (85 ft).Initially beset with technical problems as well as budget and schedule overruns, the parasols are constructed of 3,500 cubic meters of micro-laminated Finnish pine and are marketed as the world's largest wood structure.Since their opening, the parasols have become Seville's third-most visited urban landmark.


== The name ==
During development, the project was titled Metropol Parasol, with locals quickly adopting a colloquial nickname, the setas or mushrooms. Seville officially adopted the name Setas de Sevilla after discovering the project's architect had trademarked the name "Metropol Parasol" and would charge for its use; Setas de Sevilla has been the project's official name since opening,


== Design ==
The structure consists of six parasols loosely resembling large mushrooms, inspired by the vaults of the Cathedral of Seville and the ficus trees in the nearby Plaza de Cristo de Burgos.

document: The Broad, a contemporary art museum located on Grand Avenue in Downtown Los Angeles, stands as a testament to the passion for art and philanthropy of its namesake, Eli and Edythe Broad. The museum showcases an impressive art collection housed within a remarkable $140 million building that was financed by the couple. Visitors can enjoy free general admission to explore the permanent collection galleries, providing an accessible way to immerse themselves in the world of contemporary art. While the museum offers various events and exhibits, it's worth noting that not all of these are free, and admission prices may vary. Since its opening on September 20, 2015, The Broad has become an artistic haven in the heart of Los Angeles.
noref_document: The Broad is a contemporary art museum located in downtown Los Angeles, California. Founded by philanthropists Eli and Edythe Broad, the museum opened its doors to the public in 2015 and houses a vast collection of contemporary art, including works by renowned artists such as Andy Warhol, Jeff Koons, and Cindy Sherman. The building itself is an architectural marvel designed by Diller Scofidio + Renfro, featuring a unique honeycomb-like exterior that filters natural light into the galleries. With its impressive collection and striking design, The Broad has become a must-visit destination for art enthusiasts from around the world.
summary: The Broad () is a contemporary art museum on Grand Avenue in Downtown Los Angeles. The museum is named for philanthropists Eli and Edythe Broad, who financed the $140 million building that houses the Broad art collections. It offers free general admission to its permanent collection galleries. However, not all of its events are free and admission prices may vary by exhibit and/or by event. It opened on September 20, 2015.

document: Harpa, a stunning concert hall and conference center located in Reykjavik, Iceland, is a true architectural marvel. Designed by the renowned Danish firm, Henning Larsen Architects, in collaboration with the talented Danish-Icelandic artist, Olafur Eliasson, the building's exterior is adorned with a captivating colored glass facade. This unique feature draws inspiration from Iceland's breathtaking basalt landscape. Combining a steel framework with an array of geometric shaped glass panels in various vibrant colors, Harpa stands as a modern masterpiece that beautifully captures the imagination of all who encounter it.
noref_document: Harpa is a concert hall and conference center located in Reykjavík, Iceland. Designed by Olafur Eliasson and Henning Larsen Architects, it is a mesmerizing architectural marvel that has become an iconic landmark in the city. Harpa offers a unique blend of modern design and natural elements inspired by Iceland's rugged landscape. With its distinctive glass facade resembling a honeycomb, Harpa is not only visually stunning but also acoustically exceptional. Housing the Iceland Symphony Orchestra and the Icelandic Opera, it serves as a hub for world-class performances and cultural events. The concert hall's interior features multiple performance spaces, including a grand concert hall, a smaller recital hall, and a flexible theater. Harpa also houses exhibition spaces, shops, restaurants, and hosts a variety of conferences, making it a multi-functional and vibrant cultural center.
summary:
Harpa (Icelandic pronunciation: [ˈhar̥pa], English: Harp) is a concert hall and conference centre in Reykjavík, Iceland. The opening concert was held on May 4, 2011. The building features a distinctive colored glass facade inspired by the basalt landscape of Iceland.


== History ==
Harpa was designed by the Danish firm Henning Larsen Architects in co-operation with Danish-Icelandic artist Olafur Eliasson. The structure consists of a steel framework clad with geometric shaped glass panels of different colours.

document: The Office is an iconic American mockumentary sitcom that takes viewers into the amusing and sometimes cringeworthy world of office life. Set at the Scranton branch of the fictional Dunder Mifflin Paper Company in Pennsylvania, the show offers a hilarious and relatable glimpse into the everyday work lives of a diverse group of employees. Airing from 2005 to 2013, The Office spanned a total of nine seasons and quickly became a beloved television series. Created by Ricky Gervais and Stephen Merchant, the show's adaptation for American audiences was masterfully done by Greg Daniels, a seasoned writer known for his work on popular shows like Saturday Night Live, King of the Hill, and The Simpsons. Co-produced by Daniels' Deedle-Dee Productions and Reveille Productions, in association with Universal Television, The Office featured an all-star cast and successfully blended humor with insightful commentary on office politics and relationships. It quickly gained a devoted fanbase and solidified its place as a modern classic in the sitcom genre.
noref_document: The Office is a widely popular American television series that was adapted from the original British version. Premiering in 2005, the show is a mockumentary-style sitcom that revolves around the daily lives of office employees working at Dunder Mifflin Paper Company. Set in Scranton, Pennsylvania, the series humorously explores the dynamics of a quirky and diverse group of employees through their interactions, pranks, and the underlying tensions amongst them. With a talented ensemble cast led by Steve Carell as Michael Scott, the bumbling yet well-meaning regional manager, The Office captivated audiences with its relatable characters, sharp writing, and distinctive documentary-style format. The series continues to enjoy a dedicated fanbase even after its conclusion in 2013, thanks to its endearing characters and binge-worthy storytelling.
summary: The Office is an American mockumentary sitcom television series that depicts the everyday work lives of office employees at the Scranton, Pennsylvania, branch of the fictional Dunder Mifflin Paper Company. It aired on NBC from March 24, 2005, to May 16, 2013, spanning a total of nine seasons. Based on the 2001–2003 BBC series of the same name created by Ricky Gervais and Stephen Merchant, it was adapted for American television by Greg Daniels, a veteran writer for Saturday Night Live, King of the Hill, and The Simpsons. It was co-produced by Daniels' Deedle-Dee Productions and Reveille Productions (later Shine America), in association with Universal Television. The original executive producers were Daniels, Gervais, Merchant, Howard Klein, and Ben Silverman, with numerous others being promoted in later seasons.

Airing from 2005 to 2013, The Office spanned a total of nine seasons and quickly became a beloved television series. Created by Ricky Gervais and Stephen Merchant, the show's adaptation for American audiences was masterfully done by Greg Daniels, a seasoned writer known for his work on popular shows like Saturday Night Live, King of the Hill, and The Simpsons. Co-produced by Daniels' Deedle-Dee Productions and Reveille Productions, in association with Universal Television, The Office featured an all-star cast and successfully blended humor with insightful commentary on office politics and relationships. It quickly gained a devoted fanbase and solidified its place as a modern classic in the sitcom genre.
noref_document: The Office is a widely popular American television series that was adapted from the original British version. Premiering in 2005, the show is a mockumentary-style sitcom that revolves around the daily lives of office employees working at Dunder Mifflin Paper Company. Set in Scranton, Pennsylvania, the series humorously explores the dynamics of a quirky and diverse group of employees through their interactions, pranks, and the underlying tensions amongst them. With a talented ensemble cast led by Steve Carell as Michael Scott, the bumbling yet well-meaning regional manager, The Office captivated audiences with its relatable characters, sharp writing, and distinctive documentary-style format. The series continues to enjoy a dedicated fanbase even after its conclusion in 2013, thanks to its endearing characters and binge-worthy storytelling.
summary: The Office is an American mockumentary sitcom television series that depicts the everyday work lives of office employees at the Scranton, Pennsylvania, branch of the fictional Dunder Mifflin Paper Company. It aired on NBC from March 24, 2005, to May 16, 2013, spanning a total of nine seasons. Based on the 2001–2003 BBC series of the same name created by Ricky Gervais and Stephen Merchant, it was adapted for American television by Greg Daniels, a veteran writer for Saturday Night Live, King of the Hill, and The Simpsons. It was co-produced by Daniels' Deedle-Dee Productions and Reveille Productions (later Shine America), in association with Universal Television. The original executive producers were Daniels, Gervais, Merchant, Howard Klein, and Ben Silverman, with numerous others being promoted in later seasons.

document: Friends, created by David Crane and Marta Kauffman, is an iconic American television sitcom that aired on NBC from September 22, 1994, to May 6, 2004. Lasting for ten memorable seasons, the show follows the lives of six friends in their 20s and 30s who reside in Manhattan, New York City. With an ensemble cast featuring Jennifer Aniston, Courteney Cox, Lisa Kudrow, Matt LeBlanc, Matthew Perry, and David Schwimmer, Friends became a global phenomenon, captivating audiences with its relatable characters, witty humor, and heartfelt moments. Originally developed under the working title Insomnia Cafe, the show underwent various script rewrites and title changes before the series was eventually named Friends. The original executive producers, Kevin S. Bright, Kauffman, and Crane, played instrumental roles in shaping the beloved sitcom.
noref_document: "F.R.I.E.N.D.S" is a popular American sitcom that aired from 1994 to 2004. Created by David Crane and Marta Kauffman, the show revolves around a group of six friends living in Manhattan, New York. It features a blend of comedy, romance, and drama as it explores the ups and downs of their personal and professional lives. The central characters, Monica, Ross, Rachel, Chandler, Joey, and Phoebe, face relatable situations, navigating through careers, relationships, and the challenges of adulthood. With its iconic catchphrases, memorable quirks, and well-developed characters, "F.R.I.E.N.D.S" has become a cultural phenomenon and continues to captivate audiences worldwide.
summary:
Friends is an American television sitcom created by David Crane and Marta Kauffman, which aired on NBC from September 22, 1994, to May 6, 2004, lasting ten seasons. With an ensemble cast starring Jennifer Aniston, Courteney Cox, Lisa Kudrow, Matt LeBlanc, Matthew Perry and David Schwimmer, the show revolves around six friends in their 20s and 30s who live in Manhattan, New York City. The original executive producers were Kevin S. Bright, Kauffman, and Crane.
Kauffman and Crane began developing Friends under the working title Insomnia Cafe between November and December 1993. They presented the idea to Bright, and together they pitched a seven-page treatment of the show to NBC. After several script rewrites and changes, including title changes to Six of One and Friends Like Us, the series was finally named Friends.

document: How I Met Your Mother (often abbreviated as HIMYM) is an American sitcom that aired from September 19, 2005 to March 31, 2014. Created by Craig Thomas and Carter Bays for CBS, the series revolves around the life of the main character, Ted Mosby, and his group of friends in Manhattan, New York City. A unique aspect of the show is its framing device, with Ted recounting the events that led him to meet his children's mother, starting from September 2005 and spanning until May 2013. How I Met Your Mother was a joint production by Bays & Thomas Productions and 20th Century Fox Television, and it was syndicated by 20th Television (now Disney-ABC Domestic Television). The series drew inspiration from Thomas and Bays' own friendship during their time in New York, and Pamela Fryman directed the vast majority of its episodes, directing 196 out of 208.
noref_document: "How I Met Your Mother" is a popular American sitcom that aired from 2005 to 2014. Set in New York City, the show follows a group of friends and their romantic escapades, primarily through the eyes of the protagonist, Ted Mosby. The series gained a large fan base due to its witty humor, compelling narrative structure, and the iconic catchphrases it introduced, such as "legen... wait for it... dary." "How I Met Your Mother" also incorporated storytelling techniques, often using flashbacks and flash-forwards, as Ted recounts the story of how he met his children's mother. With its clever writing, relatable characters, and memorable moments, the show remains a beloved part of modern television culture.
summary:
How I Met Your Mother (often abbreviated as HIMYM) is an American sitcom, created by Craig Thomas and Carter Bays for CBS. The series, which aired from September 19, 2005 to March 31, 2014, follows the main character, Ted Mosby, and his group of friends in New York City's Manhattan. As a framing device, Ted, in 2030, recounts to his son, Luke, and daughter, Penny, the events from September 2005 to May 2013 that led him to meet their mother. How I Met Your Mother was a joint production by Bays & Thomas Productions and 20th Century Fox Television, and syndicated by 20th Television (now Disney-ABC Domestic Television).
The series was loosely inspired by Thomas and Bays' friendship when they both lived in New York. The vast majority of the episodes (196 out of 208) were directed by Pamela Fryman.

The series, which aired from September 19, 2005 to March 31, 2014, follows the main character, Ted Mosby, and his group of friends in New York City's Manhattan. As a framing device, Ted, in 2030, recounts to his son, Luke, and daughter, Penny, the events from September 2005 to May 2013 that led him to meet their mother. How I Met Your Mother was a joint production by Bays & Thomas Productions and 20th Century Fox Television, and syndicated by 20th Television (now Disney-ABC Domestic Television).
The series was loosely inspired by Thomas and Bays' friendship when they both lived in New York. The vast majority of the episodes (196 out of 208) were directed by Pamela Fryman.

document: How I Met Your Mother (often abbreviated as HIMYM) is an American sitcom that aired from September 19, 2005 to March 31, 2014. Created by Craig Thomas and Carter Bays for CBS, the series revolves around the life of the main character, Ted Mosby, and his group of friends in Manhattan, New York City. A unique aspect of the show is its framing device, with Ted recounting the events that led him to meet his children's mother, starting from September 2005 and spanning until May 2013. How I Met Your Mother was a joint production by Bays & Thomas Productions and 20th Century Fox Television, and it was syndicated by 20th Television (now Disney-ABC Domestic Television). The series drew inspiration from Thomas and Bays' own friendship during their time in New York, and Pamela Fryman directed the vast majority of its episodes, directing 196 out of 208.
noref_document: "How I Met Your Mother" is a popular American sitcom that aired from 2005 to 2014. Set in New York City, the show follows a group of friends and their romantic escapades, primarily through the eyes of the protagonist, Ted Mosby. The series gained a large fan base due to its witty humor, compelling narrative structure, and the iconic catchphrases it introduced, such as "legen... wait for it... dary." "How I Met Your Mother" also incorporated storytelling techniques, often using flashbacks and flash-forwards, as Ted recounts the story of how he met his children's mother. With its clever writing, relatable characters, and memorable moments, the show remains a beloved part of modern television culture.

document: 30 Rock, the American satirical sitcom television series created by Tina Fey, aired on NBC from October 11, 2006, to January 31, 2013. Drawing from Fey's experiences as head writer for Saturday Night Live, the show takes viewers behind the scenes of a fictional live sketch comedy show, set to air on NBC. The series is named after 30 Rockefeller Plaza in New York City, where NBC Studios and Saturday Night Live are based. Produced by Lorne Michaels's Broadway Video and Fey's Little Stranger, in association with NBCUniversal, 30 Rock episodes were shot in a single-camera setup, except for two live episodes. The series boasts a stellar cast including Alec Baldwin, Tracy Morgan, Jane Krakowski, Jack McBrayer, and more. Notably, 30 Rock employs surreal humor to satirize the intricate corporate structure of NBC, General Electric, and Comcast, its parent companies.
noref_document: 30 Rock is a landmark television series that aired from 2006 to 2013. Created by the talented comedic mind of Tina Fey, the show takes its name from the iconic address of the NBC Studios located in New York City. Known for its sharp writing and brilliant ensemble cast, 30 Rock delves into the chaotic world of producing a live sketch comedy show, fictionalizing the ups and downs of working behind the scenes at a television network. Fey's character, Liz Lemon, serves as the head writer for the show within the show, offering a humorous and relatable glimpse into the challenges and absurdities of the entertainment industry. With its clever wit, memorable characters, and satirical commentary, 30 Rock has solidified its place as one of the greatest sitcoms of all time.
summary: 30 Rock is an American satirical sitcom television series created by Tina Fey that originally aired on NBC from October 11, 2006, to January 31, 2013. The series, based on Fey's experiences as head writer for Saturday Night Live, takes place behind the scenes of a fictional live sketch comedy show depicted as airing on NBC. The series's name refers to 30 Rockefeller Plaza in New York City, where the NBC Studios are located and where Saturday Night Live is written, produced, and performed. The series was produced by Lorne Michaels's Broadway Video (which also produces Saturday Night Live) and Fey's Little Stranger, in association with NBCUniversal.30 Rock episodes were produced in a single-camera setup (with the exception of the two live episodes that were produced in the multiple-camera setup) and were filmed in New York. The pilot episode premiered on October 11, 2006, and seven seasons followed. The series stars Fey with a supporting cast that includes Alec Baldwin, Tracy Morgan, Jane Krakowski, Jack McBrayer, Scott Adsit, Judah Friedlander, Katrina Bowden, Keith Powell, Lonny Ross, John Lutz, Kevin Brown, Grizz Chapman, and Maulik Pancholy.Tonally, 30 Rock uses surreal humor to parody the complex corporate structure of NBC and its parent companies General Electric and Comcast.

Fey's character, Liz Lemon, serves as the head writer for the show within the show, offering a humorous and relatable glimpse into the challenges and absurdities of the entertainment industry. With its clever wit, memorable characters, and satirical commentary, 30 Rock has solidified its place as one of the greatest sitcoms of all time.
summary: 30 Rock is an American satirical sitcom television series created by Tina Fey that originally aired on NBC from October 11, 2006, to January 31, 2013. The series, based on Fey's experiences as head writer for Saturday Night Live, takes place behind the scenes of a fictional live sketch comedy show depicted as airing on NBC. The series's name refers to 30 Rockefeller Plaza in New York City, where the NBC Studios are located and where Saturday Night Live is written, produced, and performed. The series was produced by Lorne Michaels's Broadway Video (which also produces Saturday Night Live) and Fey's Little Stranger, in association with NBCUniversal.30 Rock episodes were produced in a single-camera setup (with the exception of the two live episodes that were produced in the multiple-camera setup) and were filmed in New York. The pilot episode premiered on October 11, 2006, and seven seasons followed. The series stars Fey with a supporting cast that includes Alec Baldwin, Tracy Morgan, Jane Krakowski, Jack McBrayer, Scott Adsit, Judah Friedlander, Katrina Bowden, Keith Powell, Lonny Ross, John Lutz, Kevin Brown, Grizz Chapman, and Maulik Pancholy.Tonally, 30 Rock uses surreal humor to parody the complex corporate structure of NBC and its parent companies General Electric and Comcast.

document: Dexter, the critically acclaimed American crime drama television series, captivated audiences from 2006 to 2013. Set in the vibrant city of Miami, the show revolves around the complex life of Dexter Morgan, a forensic technician specializing in bloodstain pattern analysis for the fictional Miami Metro Police Department. But beneath his seemingly ordinary job, Dexter hides a dark secret - he is a vigilante serial killer. Fueled by a desire to bring justice to those who have escaped punishment, he hunts down murderers who have evaded the grasp of the flawed justice system. The series, adapted from Jeff Lindsay's novel Darkly Dreaming Dexter, introduces viewers to a thrilling narrative that often diverges from the original source material, captivating fans with its twist-filled storylines and the riveting performance of Michael C. Hall in the lead role.
noref_document: "Dexter" is an acclaimed television series that aired from 2006 to 2021. It revolves around the fascinating character of Dexter Morgan, a blood-spatter analyst by day and a methodical serial killer by night. Set in Miami, the show presents a gripping storyline filled with suspense, crime, and moral ambiguity. Dexter's ability to blend seamlessly into society while satisfying his dark desires adds a unique twist to the traditional crime drama genre. With its complex characters, intricate plotlines, and exploration of themes such as vigilantism and the nature of evil, "Dexter" has garnered a dedicated fanbase and remains a prominent piece in the history of television.
summary: Dexter is an American crime drama television series that aired on Showtime from October 1, 2006, to September 22, 2013. Set in Miami, the series centers on Dexter Morgan (Michael C. Hall), a forensic technician specializing in bloodstain pattern analysis for the fictional Miami Metro Police Department, who leads a secret parallel life as a vigilante serial killer, hunting down murderers who have not been adequately punished by the justice system due to corruption or legal technicalities. The show's first season was derived from the novel Darkly Dreaming Dexter (2004), the first in a series of novels by Jeff Lindsay. It was adapted for television by James Manos Jr., who wrote the first episode. Subsequent seasons evolved independently of Lindsay's works.

Hall), a forensic technician specializing in bloodstain pattern analysis for the fictional Miami Metro Police Department, who leads a secret parallel life as a vigilante serial killer, hunting down murderers who have not been adequately punished by the justice system due to corruption or legal technicalities. The show's first season was derived from the novel Darkly Dreaming Dexter (2004), the first in a series of novels by Jeff Lindsay. It was adapted for television by James Manos Jr., who wrote the first episode. Subsequent seasons evolved independently of Lindsay's works.

document: Dexter, the critically acclaimed American crime drama television series, captivated audiences from 2006 to 2013. Set in the vibrant city of Miami, the show revolves around the complex life of Dexter Morgan, a forensic technician specializing in bloodstain pattern analysis for the fictional Miami Metro Police Department. But beneath his seemingly ordinary job, Dexter hides a dark secret - he is a vigilante serial killer. Fueled by a desire to bring justice to those who have escaped punishment, he hunts down murderers who have evaded the grasp of the flawed justice system. The series, adapted from Jeff Lindsay's novel Darkly Dreaming Dexter, introduces viewers to a thrilling narrative that often diverges from the original source material, captivating fans with its twist-filled storylines and the riveting performance of Michael C. Hall in the lead role.

document: BlackBerry OS, developed by BlackBerry Limited, was a proprietary mobile operating system for BlackBerry smartphones. It provided multitasking, specialized input devices, and support for corporate email through Java Micro Edition MIDP. With wireless activation and synchronization, users could seamlessly connect with Microsoft Exchange, Lotus Domino, or Novell GroupWise email, calendar, tasks, notes, and contacts using the BlackBerry Enterprise Server. The platform also supported WAP 2.0. Wireless carriers offered over-the-air software updates for BlackBerry OS.
noref_document: BlackBerry OS is a mobile operating system developed by BlackBerry Limited for its line of smartphones. Initially launched in 1999, BlackBerry OS became known for its strong focus on secure communication and its iconic physical keyboards. It offered users a range of features such as push email, messaging, and internet browsing. Over the years, BlackBerry OS evolved to include additional functionalities like social media integration and app support. However, with the rise of iOS and Android, BlackBerry OS faced tough competition and struggled to maintain its market share. Eventually, the company decided to discontinue the operating system in favor of adopting Android for its newer devices.
summary:
BlackBerry OS is a discontinued proprietary mobile operating system developed by Canadian company BlackBerry Limited for its BlackBerry line of smartphone handheld devices. The operating system provides multitasking and supports specialized input devices adopted by BlackBerry for use in its handhelds, particularly the trackwheel, trackball, and most recently, the trackpad and touchscreen.
The BlackBerry platform natively supports corporate email, through Java Micro Edition MIDP 1.0 and, more recently, a subset of MIDP 2.0, which allows complete wireless activation and synchronization with Microsoft Exchange, Lotus Domino, or Novell GroupWise email, calendar, tasks, notes and contacts, when used with BlackBerry Enterprise Server.  The operating system also supports WAP 2.0.
Updates to the operating system were automatically available from wireless carriers that supported the BlackBerry over the air software loading (OTASL) service.

document: Windows Phone, developed by Microsoft, was a family of mobile operating systems aimed at the consumer market. With its launch in October 2010, it introduced a new user interface inspired by the Metro design language. Unlike its predecessor, Windows Mobile, Windows Phone targeted consumers instead of enterprises. In 2012, Windows Phone 8 was released, which replaced the Windows CE-based kernel with the Windows NT kernel, similar to the one used in PC versions of Windows. Despite the improvements, this upgrade rendered Windows Phone 7 devices incompatible with the new OS. Nonetheless, it still supported apps originally developed for Windows Phone 7.
noref_document: Windows Phone was a mobile operating system developed by Microsoft. It was launched in October 2010 as the successor to Windows Mobile, and aimed to provide a unique and user-friendly experience for smartphones. Windows Phone featured a distinctive tile-based interface known as the "Metro" design language, which focused on simplicity and visual appeal. The operating system offered a wide range of features such as live tiles, seamless integration with Microsoft services, and a fluid and responsive user interface. Despite its innovative design and capabilities, Windows Phone faced tough competition from Android and iOS, and struggled to gain significant market share. Microsoft eventually announced the discontinuation of Windows Phone in 2017, shifting their focus towards other platforms.
summary: Windows Phone (WP) is a discontinued family of mobile operating systems developed by Microsoft for smartphones as the replacement successor to Windows Mobile and Zune. Windows Phone featured a new user interface derived from the Metro design language. Unlike Windows Mobile, it was primarily aimed at the consumer market rather than the enterprise market.It was first launched in October 2010 with Windows Phone 7. Windows Phone 8 succeeded it in 2012, replacing the Windows CE-based kernel of Windows Phone 7 with the Windows NT kernel used by the PC versions of Windows (and, in particular, a large amount of internal components from Windows 8). Due to these changes, the OS was incompatible with all existing Windows Phone 7 devices, although it still supported apps originally developed for Windows Phone 7.

summary: Windows Phone (WP) is a discontinued family of mobile operating systems developed by Microsoft for smartphones as the replacement successor to Windows Mobile and Zune. Windows Phone featured a new user interface derived from the Metro design language. Unlike Windows Mobile, it was primarily aimed at the consumer market rather than the enterprise market.It was first launched in October 2010 with Windows Phone 7. Windows Phone 8 succeeded it in 2012, replacing the Windows CE-based kernel of Windows Phone 7 with the Windows NT kernel used by the PC versions of Windows (and, in particular, a large amount of internal components from Windows 8). Due to these changes, the OS was incompatible with all existing Windows Phone 7 devices, although it still supported apps originally developed for Windows Phone 7.

document: Microsoft Groove, previously known as Xbox Music and Zune Music Pass, was a popular audio player software that came bundled with Windows operating systems. Alongside the software, Microsoft also offered a music streaming service called Groove Music Pass, accessible on various platforms including Windows, Xbox consoles, Windows Phone, Android, and iOS. Boasting an extensive catalogue of more than 50 million tracks, Groove Music offered users a vast selection of music to enjoy. However, Groove Music Pass was officially discontinued on December 31, 2017, with the Android and iOS versions of the Groove Music app following suit in December 2018, limiting the player to its native Microsoft Store. With the release of Windows 10 and subsequently Windows 11, Groove Music was succeeded by the Media Player, which was gradually rolled out to Windows 10 users between January and June 2023.
noref_document: Microsoft Groove, previously known as Xbox Music and Zune Music, is a digital music streaming service developed by Microsoft. It provides users with access to a vast collection of songs from various genres and artists, allowing them to stream music online or download it for offline listening. With a user-friendly interface and intuitive features, Microsoft Groove offers playlist creation, personalized recommendations, and the ability to sync music across multiple devices. Additionally, the service integrates seamlessly with Microsoft's other platforms and devices, such as Windows, Xbox, and Windows Phone, ensuring a unified music experience for its users.
summary:
Groove Music (formerly Xbox Music or Zune Music Pass) is a discontinued audio player software application included with Windows 8, Windows 8.1, Windows 10 and Windows 11.
The app is also associated with a now-discontinued music streaming service, Groove Music Pass, which was supported across Windows, Xbox video game consoles, Windows Phone, as well as Android and iOS. As of 2014, The Groove catalogue had over 50 million tracks. Its subscription service Groove Music Pass was officially discontinued on December 31, 2017, and the Android and iOS versions of the Groove Music app were discontinued in December 2018, restricting the player to its native Microsoft Store base.
Groove Music was superseded by Media Player in Windows 10 and Windows 11. The update was rolled out to Windows 10 users between January and June 2023.

document: iPhoto, a digital photograph manipulation software application developed by Apple Inc, became a prominent tool for Mac users from 2002 to 2015. It offered a range of features including importing, organizing, editing, printing, and sharing digital photos. Announced at Macworld 2002 alongside significant updates and announcements for Apple products, iPhoto soon became a part of the iLife suite of digital media management applications. In 2012, Apple introduced an iOS-native version of iPhoto, aligning it with the growing popularity of mobile devices. However, in 2014, Apple decided to discontinue iPhoto and focus on developing their new Photos app. This transition was completed in 2015 with the release of OS X Yosemite 10.10.3, which included the new Photos app.
noref_document: iPhoto is a digital photograph manipulation software application developed by Apple Inc. It was first released in 2002 as part of the iLife suite of digital media management applications. iPhoto allowed users to import, organize, edit, print, and share their photos in a seamless and user-friendly way. It featured a range of powerful tools, including basic editing functionality, filters, and effects, making it a popular choice among Mac users for managing their photo libraries. iPhoto was later replaced by the new Photos app in 2015, which offered even more advanced features and integration with cloud storage services.
summary:
iPhoto is a discontinued digital photograph manipulation software application developed by Apple Inc. It was included with every Mac computer from 2002 to 2015, when it was replaced with Apple's Photos application. Originally sold as part of the iLife suite of digital media management applications, iPhoto is able to import, organize, edit, print and share digital photos.


== History ==
iPhoto was announced at Macworld 2002, during which Steve Jobs (then-CEO of Apple) also announced that macOS would be the default operating system on new Macs, and revealed new iMac and iBook models.On March 7, 2012, Apple CEO Tim Cook announced an iOS-native version of iPhoto alongside the third-generation iPad.On June 27, 2014, Apple announced that they would cease development of iPhoto and work on a transition to their new Photos app. On February 5, 2015 Apple included a preview of Photos with a beta release of OS X Yosemite.On April 8, 2015, Apple released OS X Yosemite 10.10.3, which included the new Photos app.

document: AOL Instant Messenger (AIM) was a widely-used instant messaging program in the late 1990s and early 2000s. It allowed registered users to communicate in real time using the OSCAR and TOC protocols. AIM gained popularity in the United States and other countries, becoming the leading instant messaging application in the region. Teens and college students often utilized the away message feature to keep in touch with friends, frequently changing their messages or leaving them up to inform others of their activities, location, parties, thoughts, or jokes. However, AIM's decline began as AOL subscribers decreased, and it further declined with the rise of Gmail's Google Talk, SMS, and social networks like Facebook. Its fall has been compared with other once-popular internet services like Myspace. In 2015, AOL was acquired by Verizon Communications.
noref_document: AOL Instant Messenger, also known as AIM, was a popular instant messaging platform launched in 1997. It allowed users to communicate with contacts through real-time text-based conversations. AIM gained massive popularity in the late 1990s and early 2000s as it provided an easy way for people to connect with friends, family, and colleagues. Users could create screen names, customize their profiles, and participate in chat rooms. AIM also introduced innovative features like file sharing, voice and video chat, and integration with other services. The platform played a significant role in shaping online communication during its prime and had millions of active users. However, with the rise of social media and other messaging apps, AIM's popularity declined, leading to its discontinuation in December 2017. Despite its eventual downfall, AIM remains an iconic symbol of the early internet era.
summary:
AIM (AOL Instant Messenger) was an instant messaging and presence computer program created by AOL, which used the proprietary OSCAR instant messaging protocol and the TOC protocol to allow registered users to communicate in real time.
AIM was popular by the late 1990s, in United States and other countries, and was the leading instant messaging application in that region into the following decade. Teens and college students were known to use the messenger's away message feature to keep in touch with friends, often frequently changing their away message throughout a day or leaving a message up with one's computer left on to inform buddies of their ongoings, location, parties, thoughts, or jokes. AIM's popularity declined as AOL subscribers started decreasing and steeply towards the 2010s, as Gmail's Google Talk, SMS, and Internet social networks, like Facebook gained popularity. Its fall has often been compared with other once-popular Internet services, such as Myspace.In June 2015, AOL was acquired by Verizon Communications.

document: The iPod Classic, also known as iPod Video or just iPod, was a popular portable media player created and marketed by Apple Inc. It went through six generations, with a spin-off called the iPod Photo that later merged back into the main iPod lineup. All generations utilized a 1.8-inch hard drive for storage. The "classic" designation was formally introduced when the sixth-generation iPod was unveiled on September 5, 2007. Before this, all iPod Classic models were simply referred to as iPods. This iconic line of music players was first introduced in 2001, setting the stage for future innovations in portable music consumption.
noref_document: The iPod Classic is a portable media player created and marketed by Apple Inc. It was first introduced in 2001 and quickly became a revolutionary device that changed the way people listen to music. With its sleek design, user-friendly interface, and ample storage capacity, the iPod Classic became a must-have gadget for music enthusiasts. It allowed users to carry thousands of songs in their pocket and easily navigate through their music library. The device also popularized the concept of digital music, as it was one of the first devices to support mp3 files and introduced the iTunes platform for purchasing and managing music. Despite advancements in technology and the introduction of newer iPod models, the iPod Classic remains iconic and beloved by many for its timeless design and unparalleled music experience.
summary:
The iPod Classic (stylized and marketed as iPod classic and formerly iPod Video or just iPod) is a discontinued portable media player created and formerly marketed by Apple Inc.
There were six generations of the iPod Classic, as well as a spin-off (the iPod Photo) that was later re-integrated into the main iPod line. All generations used a 1.8-inch (46 mm) hard drive for storage. The "classic" suffix was formally introduced with the rollout of the sixth-generation iPod on September 5, 2007. Prior to this, all iPod Classic models were simply referred to as iPods; the first iPod released in 2001 was part of this line that would be called "Classic".

summary:
The iPod Classic (stylized and marketed as iPod classic and formerly iPod Video or just iPod) is a discontinued portable media player created and formerly marketed by Apple Inc.
